meta.title: Calendar Protection System: Reclaiming Your Executive Focus
meta.description: Learn how to deploy your EA as a strategic gatekeeper to protect deep work, enforce meeting buffers, and eliminate calendar creep.

hero.headline: Stop Renting Out Your Time. Start Owning It.
hero.subheadline: Transform your calendar from a reactive list of other people's priorities into a proactive engine for high-leverage outcomes.
hero.value_prop: This system turns your EA into a strategic gatekeeper who filters every request through your priorities, ensuring you only attend meetings that require your unique genius.

before.title: Reactive Chaos
pain_points: Waking up to a calendar full of surprises
No time for lunch or deep work
Feeling like your time belongs to everyone but you

after.title: Strategic Control
benefits: Meetings are clustered, leaving full days for execution
Peace of mind knowing your priorities are protected

items.label: Define your 'Maker' vs 'Manager' blocks
items.details: Identify 2-3 hour blocks for deep work (Maker) and separate blocks for back-to-back calls (Manager). Your EA will mark these as 'Busy' and 'Tentative' respectively.

items.label: Establish Meeting Clusters
items.details: Choose specific days (e.g., Tuesday/Thursday) for external calls. Tell your EA to push all non-urgent requests to these 'Heavy Meeting' days to preserve flow on other days.

items.label: Set Hard Buffer Rules
items.details: Instruct your EA to enforce a mandatory 15-minute buffer between all meetings. No back-to-backs allowed without explicit approval.

callout.content: The 'Reply with a Number' paradigm: Your EA sends 3 options for a meeting. You simply reply '2' and they handle the rest. Never look at a scheduling link again.

items.label: VIP List
items.value: Immediate booking for Board Members, Key Investors, and Direct Reports.

items.label: Qualification Questions
items.value: EA asks: 'What is the specific outcome of this meeting?' and 'Can this be resolved via email/Slack?'

items.label: Default Duration
items.value: All meetings default to 25 or 45 minutes instead of 30/60 to bake in transition time.

items.label: Scheduling Links
items.value: EA uses custom links with hidden availability to prevent 'link-surfing' by external parties.

items.label: Configure SavvyCal or Calendly Constraints
substeps: Set minimum notice period to 24 hours (No same-day surprises)
Limit max meetings per day to 6
Block out mornings before 9:00 AM and evenings after 5:30 PM

items.label: Sync Personal and Professional Calendars
items.details: Ensure your EA sees 'Busy' blocks for family commitments without seeing private details.

callout.content: We recommend SavvyCal for its 'ranked availability' which allows your EA to prioritize your meeting clusters over random open slots.

items.label: Identify 'Zombie' Meetings
items.details: EA flags recurring meetings where you haven't spoken or the value has plateaued.

items.label: The 'Delegate or Delete' Review
items.details: Monthly 15-minute sync where you and your EA review the upcoming month and cancel/delegate 10% of scheduled time.

items.label: Consolidate 1:1s
items.details: Move disparate check-ins into a single afternoon block to minimize context switching.

faq.question: How do I handle 'urgent' requests that ignore the system?
faq.answer: Define 'Urgent' for your EA. Usually, this means a client-at-risk or a major deal milestone. For everything else, the EA politely informs them: 'To ensure [Name] can give this his full attention, the earliest we can do is [Date].'

faq.question: What if a Board Member or my Boss ignores the gatekeeper?
faq.answer: Give your EA 'Executive Override' permission for a specific list of people. For everyone else, the EA should proactively reach out to reschedule conflicts that arise when these VIPs force their way onto the calendar.

faq.question: How does the EA manage travel time?
faq.answer: Your EA should use a 'Travel Buffer' template that automatically blocks 30-60 minutes before and after any off-site meeting based on Google Maps traffic estimates.
